text:
Ray's ability to shut down a faux-cultured I'm-so-dangerous threat with a direct insult - no fucking around, just a straight nut shot - is part of what makes this strip.

You don't bring that weak shit up against the son of the Man With Blood On His Hands.

name: woof
text: alt text: No, I don't know who any of these characters are. I took some screenshots at Keenspot.

text:
That one is the fairy Airalea.

She does not wish your people any harm.

So it's cool.

name: semiquaver
text: That is Otra from Girly, right?  Seems pretty unsporting to do that to a guy who's repeatedly given Achewood props and seems to have a similarly novel take on comic humor.

text: Do you see an O on her shirt? NO YOU DO NOT.

name: semiquaver
text: Onstad didn't know that Otra always wore that shirt.  How would he?  I imagine he just sketched whatever shirt would look fine.  He only used the drawings of other characters for inspiration, he wasn't trying to perfectly copy them

text: "Cynical dyke who always needs coffee and talks about coffee" is Shadehawk, a male character from "Antihero for Hire." It is not mocked undeservedly.

name: wittyname
text: I don't think it is, because Shadehawk is a guy. And that isn't a terrible webcomic, but I stopped reading it a long time ago.

name: fermatprime
text:
The first time I saw this strip, I assumed it was Dominic Deegan. Which is like Achewood in that it generally lacks a conventional "punchline" to its strips. (Sadly, it also lacks anything really resembling humor in any way.)

'Course, with a title like that, I can only assume that he's a Deegan ripoff.

name: lunchbox
text: Yeah, someone linked me to a comic a while ago where the cat character is featured. It's created by a furry porn artist, and the comic is called Better Days. Read through it just because it was some weird shit that I couldn't pry my eyes away from. I remember hearing that Chris just copied a bunch of character faces from Keenspot advertisements.

name: zefiel
text: You forgot to mention all the incestuous furry sex scenes between cat brothers, sexual abuse, and the furry depiction of Desert Storm.

name: saru
text:
Did you hear that from... the alt text?
"No, I don't know who any of these characters are. I took some screenshots at Keenspot."

name: zefiel
text:
I think you're missing the point. Better Days features a furry depiction of Operation Desert Storm .

That should make amerika reconsider its ways, it should.

P.S. Nice eyebrows and vespa.

name: direhaggis
text: Beef has a beef with overly dramatic web-things. Seems similar to his attitude of Ray when he's drunk or doing something overly dramatic.

name: lazarusloafer
text: Comic Sans is the disease inside of our community.

name: honesttom
text:
This feels like the natural companion piece to the prank calling arc. Like, Onstad smacked Garfield and Marmaduke down with his cartoon baseball bat, and now there's the new guys all like, "Let's see what you can do, old man".

This made more sense when it first occurred to me.

name: saru
text: I am sorry. I recognize and accept my lames, and understand now that sometimes, Assetbar is not necessarily the place to muse out loud.

name: achilleselbow
text: That's bullshit. You didn't deserve any of those, I'm wondering the same things. I refuse to accept the fact that the only thing acceptable on assetbar is snarky one-liners and "omg I totally say this all the time".

name: timmul
text:
assetbar, I'm pretty sure, is an achewood easter egg where if you manage to wade through restatements of previous (or current) punchlines, snarky one-liners, endless debates of whether something should be chubbied versus lamed, the alt-text, and potentially a boss fight against asherdan, you get to read an amusing story next to a tiny picture of stephen fry.

in all honesty after I created an account I read the things that were filtered out because they were lamed too much and realized there was too much social shit to deal with in my life and I wasn't ready to worry whether or not an internet community will like me. I like to read the assets because sometimes people can be funny or insightful but oftentimes it has the least vocal people determining that other people will not enjoy someone's entirely benign comment because it is not "omg I totally say this all the time".

in short: "Nonsense!" && I totally said "What the fuck, man?!" today and it was amazing.

name: achilleselbow
text: And you're a douchebag. Which is worse?

name: doc_rostov
text:
The strip is as well written as always, but I'd say your point is well taken. Onstad could just as easily have picked out some truly bad webcomics a la John Solomon , but for whatever reason chose to just take a randomizer and assume the worst instead of doing a bit of cursory research to make sure he was picking deserving subjects of his rapier of wit. Onstad did sort of drop the ball on this one a bit by generically pulling webcomics regardless of their content and skewering them. Not everyone can get everything right, though, so I don't think this is a particularly great injustice. I think the classic line from the last panel makes up for the unusual lack of direction. At least a four (to me)...

But please note that you are perfectly obliged to write your opinions on Assetbar. This isn't exactly the Roman Pantheon, here. Doesn't need to be Sycophant City. I'd say it's better to see a post or two of honest critique than yet another instance of Soticoto being a douche or the nameless hordes grinning wildly about how they have apparently fallen upon the remarkable mental capacity required to incorporate Onstad's lines into their common vernacular.

Let's get us some quality analysis here, guys!

name: therealsnazzle
text: But shouldn't we also consider the fact that it's maybe not the specific comics that he's mocking, but the attitude that some of these web comic cartoonists have? I.e., their complete pomposity over something that they spent slaving over in MS Paint, making them think they have something that qualifies as "art". That's what I got from it, at least.

name: soticoto
text:
Like you have the first clue what quality analysis is. You couldn't tell your own foot from the dogshit smeared on the underside.
You're basically a petty brat, and I'd know since I can be plenty petty myself when I want to be.

Now... I have better things to be saying to far better people than your low self. Adieu.

name: wacks
text:
A shoe is an item of cscs exam footwear evolved at first to protect the human foot and later, additionally, as an item of psat exam decoration in itself. The foot contains more bones than any other single part of the body, and has evolved over hundreds of thousands of years in relation to vastly varied terrain and climatic conditions. Together with the proprioceptive system, it is sat exam what makes balance and ambulation possible.

Until recent years, shoes were not ptcb exam worn by most of the world's population%u2014largely because they could not afford them. Only with the advent of mass production, making available for the first time the cheap flip-flop-type sandal, for example, has shoe-wearing series 7 exam become predominant.
